@Usage:@: @   Build pico.js from src/*.js to current directory.                          @
@   1. Build pico.js from src/*.js to current directory.                       @
scripts.build:lib: find src -name "*.js" | sort | xargs cat > ./pico.js; sed -i '' "s#pico.name *= *".*" *;#pico.name = \"${npm_package_name}\";#" pico.js; sed -i '' "s#pico.version *= *".*" *;#pico.version = \"${npm_package_version}\";#" pico.js; sed -i '' "s#\(console.log.*;\)#//\1#g" pico.js
scripts.build:out: if [ -n "${npm_config_out}" ]; then mkdir -p ${npm_config_out}; cp pico.* index.* ${npm_config_out}; fi
scripts.build:main: if [ -n "${npm_config_out}" ] && [ -n "${npm_config_main}" ]; then for app in ${npm_config_main%.*}.js*; do cp $app ${npm_config_out}/app.${app##*.}; done; fi
scripts.build:sub: if [ -n "${npm_config_out}" ] && [ -n "${npm_config_sub}" ]; then for sub in ${npm_config_sub//,/ }; do mkdir -p ${npm_config_out}/${sub%/*}; cp $sub ${npm_config_out}/${sub%/*}/; done; fi;
scripts.build: npm run build:lib; npm run build:out; npm run build:main; npm run build:sub
scripts.clean:sub: if [ -n "${npm_config_out}" ] && [ -n "${npm_config_sub}" ]; then for sub in ${npm_config_sub//,/ }; do rm ${npm_config_out}/$sub; rmdir ${npm_config_out}/${sub%/*}; done; fi
scripts.clean:out: if [ -n "${npm_config_out}" ]; then rm ${npm_config_out}/pico.*; rm ${npm_config_out}/index.*; rmdir ${npm_config_out}; fi
scripts.clean: npm run clean:sub; npm run clean:main; npm run clean:out
